alert.note: Alert for Alameda; Contra Costa; Marin; San Francisco; San Mateo (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 15 at 10:43PM PST by NWS Monterey
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM PST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected along an approaching frontal boundary. * WHERE...A portion of northern California, including the following areas, Alameda, Contra Costa, Marin, San Francisco and San Mateo. * WHEN...Until 100 AM PST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Overflowing poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1043 PM PST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain producing one-quarter to one-half inch of rainfall per hour. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Overflowing poor drainage areas will cause minor flooding in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... San Francisco, Oakland, Concord, Berkeley, Richmond, Daly City, San Leandro, Mountain View, Alameda, Walnut Creek, South San Francisco, San Bruno, Pacifica, Martinez, Pleasant Hill, San Pablo, Lafayette, El Cerrito, San Lorenzo and Castro Valley. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.

area.areaDesc: Alameda; Contra Costa; Marin; San Francisco; San Mateo
